001package pkg_class;
002
003/**
004 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
005 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.
006 * 
007 * This class holds information about a command that was issued by the user.
008 * A command currently consists of three strings: a command word, a second
009 * word and a third one (for example, if the command was "take apple 3", then the 3 strings
010 * obviously are "take", "map" and 3).
011 * 
012 * The way this is used is: Commands are already checked for being valid
013 * command words. If the user entered an invalid command (a word that is not
014 * known) then the command word is null.
015 *
016 * If the command had only one word, then the second and third word are null.
017 * 
018 * @author Elie DUBOUX 
019 * @version 2021.01
020 * @see Parser
021 */
022public abstract class Command
023{
024    /**
025     * The graphical user interface.
026     */
027    protected UserInterface aGui;
028    /**
029     * The second word.
030     */
031    private String aSecondWord;
032    /**
033     * The third word.
034     */
035    private String aThirdWord;
036    
037    /**
038     * Constructor.
039     */
040    public Command()
041    {
042        this.aSecondWord = null;
043        this.aThirdWord  = null;
044    }//Command()
045    
046    /**
047     * Return the second word of this command. If the command was not
048     * understood, the result is null.
049     * @return The second word.
050     */
051    public String getSecondWord()
052    {
053        return this.aSecondWord;
054    }//getSecondWord()
055    
056    /**
057     * Return the third word of this command. If the command was not
058     * understood, the result is null.
059     * @return The third word.
060     */
061    public String getThirdWord()
062    {
063        return this.aThirdWord;
064    }//getThirdWord()
065    
066    /**
067     * Check if the command has a second word.
068     * @return True if the command has a second word,
069     * false if it does not.
070     */
071    public boolean hasSecondWord()
072    {
073        return this.aSecondWord != null;
074    }//hasSecondWord()
075    
076    /**
077     * Check if the command has a third word.
078     * @return True if the command has a third word,
079     * false if it does not.
080     */
081    public boolean hasThirdWord()
082    {
083        return this.aThirdWord != null;
084    }//hasThirdWord()
085    
086    /**
087     * Get and transform the third word if it is a number.
088     * @return The third word if it is a number, 1 if not.
089     */
090    public int getThirdWordNumber()
091    {
092        if (!this.hasThirdWord())
093            return 1;
094        
095        int d = 1;
096        try 
097        {
098            d = Integer.parseInt(this.aThirdWord);
099        }
100        catch (NumberFormatException e) 
101        {
102            d = 1;
103        }
104        finally
105        {
106            return d;
107        }
108    }//isThirdWord()
109    
110    /**
111     * Define the second word of this command (the word
112     * entered after the command word). Null indicates that 
113     * there was no second word.
114     * @param pSecondWord The second word
115     */
116    public void setSecondWord(final String pSecondWord)
117    {
118        this.aSecondWord = pSecondWord;
119    }//setSecondWord()
120    
121    /**
122     * Define the third word of this command (the word
123     * entered after the second word). Null indicates that 
124     * there was no third word.
125     * @param pThirdWord The third word
126     */
127    public void setThirdWord(final String pThirdWord)
128    {
129        this.aThirdWord = pThirdWord;
130    }//setThirdWord()
131    
132    /**
133     * Define the gui for this command.
134     * @param pGui The gui.
135     */
136    public void setGui(final UserInterface pGui)
137    {
138        this.aGui = pGui;
139    }//setGui()
140    
141    /**
142     * Get the corresponding room with it's name.
143     * Used in Test and Alea commands.
144     * @param pRoomName The name of the room.
145     * @return The room, can be null.
146     */
147    protected Room getTpRoom(final String pRoomName)
148    {
149        String vRoomName = pRoomName.toLowerCase();
150        for (Room vRoom : this.aGui.getRooms())
151            if(vRoom.getName().toLowerCase().equals(vRoomName))
152                return vRoom;
153        return null;
154    }
155    
156    /**
157     * Execute this command.
158     * @param pPlayer The player doing the action.
159     */
160    public abstract void execute(final Player pPlayer);
161}//Command
